Metadata: COASTAL BARS CAN BE DANGEROUS! TIPS FOR CROSSING SAFELY

What is a coastal bar? Quite simply, it is an underwater sand or gravel bank at a river mouth that obstructs navigation. Simple as that may sound, it poses special hazards to mariners. This fact sheet explains what a coastal bar is, how they form, what makes them dangerous, how tides affect crossing them, and when is the right tide for crossing. KW: SAFETY; BOATING.
